description: n/p^k, where p = largest prime dividing n and p^k = highest power of p dividing n.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
example: a(36) = 4 because 36/3^2 = 4, 3^2 is highest power dividing 36 of largest prime dividing 36.a(50) = 50 / 5^2 = 2.
author: _Leroy Quet_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jan 21 2000
